definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes

sentences.english: The two sisters share the same likes and dislikes.
sentences.chinese: 這兩姐妹有相同的好惡愛憎。
這就是爲什麼“愛憎交織”如此重要。

sentences.english: I usually will ask your helpful, neither overbearing nor servile, likes and dislikes clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我在平時就要求自己樂於助人，不卑不亢，愛憎分明。

sentences.english: True friendship have in common to hate.
sentences.chinese: 真正的友誼產生於共同的愛憎之中。

definition: lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
lit. seeing others go hunting, one is excited by memories of the thrill of the hunt (idiom)/fig. seeing others do what one loves to do, one is inspired to try it again
to use one's mouth (to say sth)
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: hard to tell if it's real or sham
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
